0: Valet parking makes it tedious to come and go without prior planning since you have to call ahead for your car or wait 10 minutes or so at the entrance if you do not
But the first hidden fee is the valet parking that is 35 dollars per day this service has improved since we have read bad reviews
The cons would have to be that it is more on the expensive side eg valet parking costs a pretty penny
Valet parking no option adds 40 a night to your tab

There is no self parking option and the valet parking is therefore forced upon you at the pricely sum of 35 night which seems very steep when you have already spent a chunk of money to book into the hotel in the first place

We had a rental car and the parking valet line coming in to the resort was frequently long but less troublesome when we wanted to go outside of the resort since we could call down and have the car waiting for us
If you are by car I would park at the mall across the street as the valet service is at close to 40 incl tax too expensive in my opinion
The valet parking was not good always late
That I had to call each time to get my car would rather just go to where it is parked myself
There is some construction going on to complete the water park but staff goes out of their way to accommodate the guests
1: The new pool area is a bit like a theme park you go through an entrance area with turnstyles and a scan of your wrist band to make sure you can enter
After you play 38 dollars to park
The water park “ Tidal Cove ” is great for both kids and adults
The restaurant food was excellent however the valet parking service lost our car and destroyed otherwise a nice evening NEVER AGAIN
The food and drinks in the water park were great too
Excellent Excellent service and great water park

The pool was great the water park is insane and kept the kids busy all day great food and service at the pool you get so spoiled that when you have to wait more than 5 minutes for something you get upset Sofs bar was awesome too ca n’t wait to come back
